lenders.name: Radiology Network
lenders.loan_because: radRounds Radiology Network hopes to donate its resources and funds to entrepreneurs and organizations (NGOs and non-profits) that aim to improve global health.
lenders.occupational_info: radRounds Radiology Network is a radiology and medical imaging professional network for building relationships in clinical practice, education, career, research, and industry.  We thousand of medical imaging professional and physician (radiologists) members.  radRounds.org is our non-profit social venture arm which runs this KIVA page and is dedicated completely to supporting and raising venture funds to help improve access to quality care, availability of low-cost medical imaging technologies abroad, and effectively to improve global healthcare delivery.

lenders.name: International Radiology
lenders.loan_because: We aim to improve access to quality care, availability of high-tech medical imaging in regions needing critical diagnostic imaging services, and to effectively aid in the practice of medicine abroad in resource poor settings.  We support all individuals and organizations who also share our passion for improving healthcare and are interested in medical imaging technology.
lenders.occupational_info:
We are a nonprofit organization providing radiology interpretation and imaging expertise to humanitarian medical organizations as well as physicians in developing world. Our group is comprised of subspecialized academic radiologists, radiology residents and fellows, other healthcare professionals and imaging technologists.

We offer:

    * Interpretation of radiology studies obtained by humanitarian medical organizations and medical missions.
    * Interpretation of radiology studies for physicians requiring primary reading.
    * Secondary consultation on studies obtained and reviewed elsewhere.
    * 3D reconstruction or imaging modifications such as for surgical planning.
    * Education of imaging related topics.

lenders.occupational_info:
Aoteroa/New Zealand was isolated from the rest  of the world until only about 1000 years ago when the first people (Tangata Whenua or Maori) arrived. Europeans did not discover it until 300 years ago. Before people there were no mammals and many birds had filled that role and nested on the ground and many were flightless. There were relatively few plant species. Since settlement, especially white (Pakeha) colonisation, many animals and plants have been brought here. Many have become serious pests (there are now as many 'weeds' as there are native plants!).
My job is in pest control administration. We try to minimise the effects of pests on our ecosystem and identify new pests and attempt to eradicate them before they spread.
I work for a regional council.

A man was walking along a coastline covered with thousands of dying starfish that had been stranded by the falling tide. He came across a woman walking in the opposite direction, picking up starfish and throwing them into the ocean.

"Why do you bother?", he asked her. " There are so many of them! You can't possibly throw back enough to make a difference."

The woman picked up another starfish, threw it into the ocean, and replied, "I made a difference to that one".

lenders.name: Victoria
lenders.loan_because: We all have the power to make a difference in the world. I believe that if it is within our power to make a positive difference in someone's life, there is no good reason not to. Also, loaning through kiva is a good way to feel more connected to the global community.
lenders.occupational_info: Well, I am an artist. I feel a constant need to create new and beautiful and exciting things. I like to be provocative and controversial, and express things that can only be communicated through a canvas.

lenders.loan_because: we could all use a hand sometimes.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a web developer for an ecommerce company.

lenders.name: Wayne
lenders.loan_because: It is a great idea and KIVA makes it easy to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am director of a public library district in northern Idaho (USA) about 70 miles south of the British Columbia (Canada) border.  The district serves a population of 32,000 people from two branch libraries and a bookmobile.  These libraries are heavily used and rank 6th in materials checked out and 7th in patron visits among approximately 140 public libraries within the state.  See the library web page  @ http://www.ebcl.lib.id.us/ebcl/ .

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: my parents, friends and community have given me so much that this is just another way that I can try to give someone else a chance to succeed.

lenders.loan_because: A minuscule effort on my part helps someone else make a huge impact on theirs.

I have a full-time employee job where I work as a software engineer, that is I write software programs, which in this case are used in command and control centers for fire-fighters, ambulance, ...

Besides this job, I start up a business where I create and sell my own software product DemoRecorder which is a screen recorder for Linux.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a full time manager in a gas and electrcity company in the UK. In my spare time I run a few websites. We are using the revenue from the advertisements placed on one of our websites  - EnergyBook (free and green worldwide marketplace) to fund our loans through Kiva.

lenders.name: Armand
lenders.loan_because:
I think microfinance is a great idea to help poor or vulnerable farmers, who cannot lend at an official bank. I learned this, when I was helping a Vietnamese Ph. D. student at the university of Antwerp.
Now in 2010 already 2 students got their Ph. D. I will help a third one.
Unfortunally enough KIVA is not active in the Mekong Delta.
So I started to help people from other  countries.

lenders.loan_because: I want entrepreneurs to help themselves help their neighbors without forwarding religious superstitions.
lenders.occupational_info: Reasoned and friendly efforts to help people come out of God's musty closet into the sunlight of personal freedom and self-responsibility. That's why I wrote the book, Out of God's Closet: This Priest Psychologist Chooses Friendly Atheism.

lenders.loan_because: Recycling funds is a way to share some of my own gracious plenty with the world which is, I think, the defintion of prosperity.
lenders.occupational_info: I write mystery novels based out of my experience working as a psychic.  I'm also a nurse and have worked most recently  in the area of alternative health.

lenders.name: Frederick
lenders.loan_because: I just lost a substantial portion of my income.  Though I'm still able to pay my bills I'm now is situation where my discretionary income is largely gone.  Becoming involved with Kiva helped me to realize that my financial situation is really not all that important.  I’ve resolved to give a $25.00 donation from each pay check and, as my income expands, will increase this amount.  My ultimate goal is to establish a war chest of $5,000 that I can use to help others with.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an administrator in a hospital

Outside of work, I volunteer my time as a director, acting coach and website designer / webmaster for a young performers (ages 5-18) community theatre group.
